oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1960-05-07 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from May 7, 1960. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Roy Acuff (host/performer) with his Smoky Mountain Boys (including Howdy Forrester, June Webb, Bashful Brother Oswald, Jimmy Riddle, Lonnie Wilson, and Shot Jackson), guest performer Hank Locklin, and regular performers Archie Campbell, Tommy Jackson, and June Carter. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1074th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: June Carter; Don Gibson; Hank Locklin; Bashful Brother Oswald; Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Roy Acuff introduces June Carter -- Comedy routine (June Carter, Roy Acuff) -- The Proof Is In The Puffing (Don Gibson) (recording) -- Grant Turner introduces Hank Locklin -- Send Me The Pillow That You Dream On (Hank Locklin) -- Roy Acuff introduces Bashful Brother Oswald -- Southern Moon (Bashful Brother Oswald) -- Grant Turner and Roy Acuff announce his tour schedule -- Precious Memories (Roy Acuff, cast) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Roy Acuff) -- Camel Cigarettes jingle -- Network announcements (Grant Turner)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Sloan, Ralph; Tennessee Travelers; Jackson, Tommy; Campbell, Archie; Cash, June Carter, 1929-2003; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Webb, June, 1934-; Bashful Brother Oswald; Riddle, Jimmy, 1918-1982; Forrester, Howdy, 1922-1987; Jackson, Shot; Wilson, Lonnie; Locklin, Hank; Martin, Grady, 1929-; Gibson, Don (Donald Eugene), 1928-2003
